basics.name: Vanessa Gerber
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am majoring in Computer Science (BS) and Geography (BA) as a second year student currently studying at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2020.

volunteer.summary: Supervise and coordinate middle and high school Science Olympiad events at state and invitational competitions.
highlights: Coordinating, supervising, and judging Division B "Game On" programming event for stale level competition in April, 2019.
Coordinated, supervised, and judged Division C "Write It Do It" event at Mililani High School invationals (2017-2019).
Learned time managment and coordination skills.

volunteer.summary: Helped promote team on a professional level mainly through promotional videos.
highlights: Created weekly recap videos by edditing together pictures, videos, and interviews I had conducted and taken throughout the week.
Wrote and laid out monthly newletters updating sponsors and supporters on the club's activity throughout the year.
Made pitches to potential sponsors by talking to local businesses.
Helped design stickers, buttons, and tshirts.
Helped promote and carry out fundraisers i.e. Ice Cream salesat school carnival.
Communicated with other teams to gather information and promote our robot as a potential ally at the state competition
Chosen embassador to welcome Governor Ige at the state competition and provide him with a tour.
summary: Competed in Science Olympiad and hosted STEM learning camps.
highlights: Secretary (2016-17).
Competed in various events including "Write It Do It", "Astronomy", "Anatomy", "Expreimental Design", and "Bridge Building".
Won various medals at various levels throughout my time as a member.
Helped organized invitationals.
Fundraised at school carnival.
This club and the Science Olympiad competition is what catalyzed my interest in STEM by exposing me to a range of STEM subjects to explore.

summary: Exposed kids grades 3-5 to STEM activities such as programming in scratch and engineering paper rollercoasters in  week long, student run STEM Camp.
highlights: Supervised and helped teach kids programming basics in Scratch and Hour Of Code (2015)
Coordinated and supervised rollercoaster engineering, sound waves, and treasure hunt activies (2016)
Learned valuable time management, communication, and teamwork skills

summary: Fundraising event for the American Cancer society hosted at Mililani High School by student club members.
highlights: Luminaria Chair (2015 - 2016) - Coordinated the luminaria ceremony in honor of those whose lives have been touched by cancer. Included advertising, selling, and displaying lanterns as well as creating commemoration slideshow.
Filmed and interviewed at the event to put together a recap/promotional video under a time crunch (2016)
Learned valuable time management, communication, and teamwork skills

awards.title: National Contest Senior Group Documentary Finalist
awards.summary: Placed 12th out of over 120 entries at the national level competition for a documentary on the legacy of Andre Breton, a leader in the Surrealist art movement.

awards.title: National Contest Senior Group Documentary Qualifier
awards.summary: Competed at the national national level competition for a documentary on the explorations, encounters, and exchange of Pop Art.

awards.title: Science Olympiad Medalist
awards.summary: Won various medals (1st to 3rd place) at various competition levels (invitationals to states) by competing in the Science Olympiad Competition throughout middle and highschool.
